result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:44 AM Defendant Damon Amonie Green in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses initial appearance in 22CM602.
Defense acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court extends Attorney Ponath's appointment to this matter.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:24 AM Defendant Damon Amonie Green not in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court notes the defendant is currently set for plea and sentencing on June 13, 2022 at 9:00 am and is represented by Attorney Sarah Ponath on his other matter.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance to the defendants next date before the Trial Court.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
